full_summary:
F2596-23LC09 Seasonal Vessel Conference
=====================================

### Notice Details

*   **Reference Number**: WS4223606803
*   **Solicitation Number**: WS4223606803
*   **Publication Date**: 17 November 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date**: 7 December 2023, 14:00 EST (Expired)
*   **Expected Contract Start Date**: 1 February 2024
*   **Expected Contract End Date**: 1 May 2029
*   **Procurement Category**: SRV

### Invitation to Bid

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is inviting interested bidders to submit proposals for the provision of conference facilities and accommodation for the Canadian Coast Guard's Central Region Seasonal Vessel Officers. The proposed project will take place from 5 to 9 February 2024, with an optional extension for two additional years.

### Background

The proposed project involves providing conference facilities and accommodation for the officers at designated hotels in London, Ontario, and Kingston, Ontario. The successful bidder must demonstrate compliance with all mandatory technical criteria, failure to do so will render the offer non-responsive and ineligible for further consideration.

### Proposal Requirements

*   The successful bidder must provide a comprehensive proposal, detailing how they will meet the project's requirements.
*   The bidder must demonstrate their ability to provide the required conference facilities and accommodation within the specified timeframes.
*   The bidder must clearly outline their approach to meeting the project's technical requirements.

### Tender Process

*   The tender process is an open bidding process.
*   Bidders must submit their proposals in compliance with the tender documents and requirements.
*   The PSPC reserves the right to award the contract to the bidder who meets the requirements and provides the best value.

### Contact Information

*   Allison Fernandez, PSPC, (she/her)
*   Email: allison.fernandez@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
*   Phone: (365)340-5724

The English and French versions of the tender description provide more details of the project requirements and evaluation criteria. Interested bidders should refer to the tender documents and requirements for further information. The tender process will be conducted in accordance with the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

### Related Links

*   [Notice URL (English)](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18042387?extsite=MTgwNDIzODdfQU4
